meanings.definition: A man-made watercourse or aqueduct used for conveying water, typically for irrigation or power generation.
meanings.sent1: The leat brought water to the fields for farming.
meanings.sent2: The workers dug a leat to channel water to the mill.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kids played in the leat, pretending it was a river.
meanings.sent4: The leat snaked through the valley like a silver ribbon.
meanings.sent5: The sparkling water in the leat reflected the sunlight beautifully.

meanings.definition: To divert water into a leat.
meanings.sent1: They needed to leat water from the river to the reservoir.
meanings.sent2: The farmer decided to leat water from the stream to his crops.
meanings.sent3: The clever engineer used a clever system to leat water uphill.
meanings.sent4: She had to leat the water quickly before the storm arrived.
meanings.sent5: The old windmill leated water up to the top of the hill effortlessly.

meanings.definition: The act of constructing or maintaining a leat.
meanings.sent1: The leat-building project required skilled workers.
meanings.sent2: His job involved the maintenance of the leat system.
meanings.sent3: The community came together for a leat-building competition.
meanings.sent4: She approached the leat construction with enthusiasm and dedication.
meanings.sent5: The ancient civilization's leat construction techniques were impressive.
